page.title: 04Papworth Everard School
page.content:
Papworth School has been designated a Community School and plays a major role in the community. There are about 60 children on roll. The school is of an older design but does have its own swimming pool. Meals for the children are brought in containers from another school's kitchen. The school is basically organised into 2 classes.
The school's catchment area is the Village Settlement and Hospital and this places it in a unique position. Children at age 11 move on to Swavesey Village College, and if they choose to continue education beyond 16 travel to Cambridge.
